channel.title: Brooklyn on Table41NYC
channel.description: Recent content in Brooklyn on Table41NYC

item.title: Delaware and Hudson
item.description: 2016 and 2017 Michelin 1 star. Tasting only for dinner. Atlantic food. Fantastic.

item.title: Greenpoint Fish and Lobster
item.description: Surprisingly good. The oyster shuckers did a good job keeping it juicy. Happy hour is cheap!

item.title: Cape House
item.description: Scallops and clam strips were good. Pickles were salty not sour.

item.title: Sunken Hundred
item.description: Good restaurant. I like the spanish octopus, fish churros, and pork chop. Unfortunately, it’s CLOSED.

item.title: Wanpaku
item.description: Decent ramen in the Greenpoint area.

item.title: Yuji Ramen
item.description: Ramen omakase. Really good. Everything is homemade. $130 per person.

item.title: Ryujin Ramen
item.description: It’s just ok. I’d go to other ramen places over this.

item.title: Ichiran
item.description: A little expensive but pretty good. It’s like a much better version of Shinsengumi.

item.title: Champion
item.description: There are actually a lot of locations for this. I think Vinnie’s way better in the north Williamsburg area.

item.title: Roberta's
item.description: Pizza is pretty good and cheap. Their beer list is pretty good.

item.title: Vinnie's
item.description: My cousin Vinnie’s place is the best. Love the cali burger.

item.title: Olmsted
item.description: Was pretty good surprisingly, though the portion sizes were way too small. Ended up eating some rhubarb pie afterwards.

item.title: Leuca
item.description: New American centric. Cheap but not too expensive. In the Vale hotel.

item.title: Lucky Luna
item.description: Got the pozole here which seems to be uncommon here in NYC. Spicy, but pretty good. Too bad it’s CLOSED.

item.title: Llama Inn
item.description: This place was pretty good. It’s expensive sorta, but the lomo saltado was decent.

item.title: Bulbap Grill
item.description: This place was ok in Greenpoint. The soondobu was probably the better thing to get. They do have Korean style tacos.

item.title: Kichin
item.description: Decent bibimbap, but don’t go out of your way for this.

item.title: Dotory
item.description: Really good. I like their kimchi jigae because it’s super sour. Don’t get their soondobu. It sucks.

item.title: Okonomi
item.description: Really good Japanese breakfast place.

item.title: Lilia Cafe
item.description: Had to make reservations 30 days ahead of time. Food was decent. Interior is nice. Homemade pasta. Good date place. Slightly overrated. Very similar to Culver City Bucato (before it shuttered) a few years ago.

item.title: Gran Sasso
item.description: Really good. Homemade pasta, and steak was good. Wasn’t that expensive either. Has been renamed to Scriptum Brooklyn. Not sure if it’s the same place.

item.title: Golden Years
item.description: Fried chicken sandwich was ok. Has a kick to it just like every fried chicken sandwich place. Cash only though. Don’t think I’d care to come back.

item.title: Emmy Squared
item.description: This was really good and pretty spicy with the right kick. Everything is good here including the Detroit style pizzas.

item.title: Rider
item.description: Was actually really good, and was one of the first places I went to when I moved here.

item.title: Ample Hills Creamery
item.description: Got the pistachio brittle, and it was mediocre. I think Van Leeuwen is better.
